thread.title: Pavement parkers get £30 fine and spark debate
thread.title_full: Pavement parkers get £30 fine and spark debate | Wales - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Pavement parkers get £30 fine and spark debate
text:
To park or not to park - on a pavement. It cost these two motorists £30 fines after police spotted their vehicles half parked on residential footpaths.
SW Police Cardiff @swpcardiff Follow #ElyNPT - Fine? Yes, £30. Please do not park blocking the footpath. ^MJ http://t.co/Al4vLpnSQh
20:09 - 8 Sep 2015 Retweet Reply Favourite South Wales Police slapped the owners with a fine after the car and van were spotted blocking footpaths in the Ely area of Cardiff.
There was support for the cash penalty from some - one Twitter user said:
Hope you can spread the word around Whitchurch as it's a common crime
– Twitter user While another asked:
Is this an offence? Big debate in Fairwater on whether is is or not?
– Twitter user SW Police Cardiff @swpcardiff Follow #ElyNPT PCSOs Jordan & Davies were on patrol during school finishing time.Parking like this will cost you £30! ^MJ http://t.co/LAB4mTqOOw
16:09 - 9 Sep 2015 Retweet Reply Favourite Others joined in with shaming other drivers who have blocked pedestrians from using other footpaths in the city and calling for police action in their streets.
Last updated Wed 9 Sep 2015 Travel Wales Cardiff
